comment: He knows what he's doing and he's great at it. Dr. McNeill helped build my confidence in my writing and my over all ability to use my degree. Although he is slightly intimidating, he is very helpful and wants what's best. Also very organized, just keep up with deadlines and you'll be fine. I wish I had taken more classes with him.

Extremely useful Capstone course. As with any Capstone, there is a lot of work involved, but Dr. McNeill divides up work evenly throughout the semester and is quick to respond to any questions that arise. Very clear about course objectives. Highly recommend him.

respect him and he'll respect you. show up to class. attendance isn't mandatory, but he notices. really helpful when you're respectful. 5 grades at 20%: 2 tests (the 1st killed me; very hard), 2 projects (1 group), almost weekly discussions counted as 1 big grade (lotsa reading to do these). his lectures are amazing; to the point. would recommend.

I've had McNeill for two classes and never had a problem with his grading!  Sure, if you don't pay attention and are rude/late/etc. he won't want to be helpful. But I never thought he wasn't willing to help solve problems.  Knowledgeable, sometimes goes on tangents (but they're pretty funny usually).

The first class I had with McNeill was a breeze. This class was miserable. There are only two tests, which were EASY. The rest of your grade, 60% to be exact, consists of group projects. I had the same morons in my group for all of my projects and I could not get any help from McNeill. Sure, he is smart but also arrogant and unsympathetic.
Easy class. Mostly PowerPoint presentations. Never takes attendance. Hates people talking when he talks. Highly recommend him! I'm taking another one of his classes in the fall.

I took him for Mass Communication and for digital media production. I think he is SO SMART, has an answer for everything. He is very helpful and will ALWAYS be available for extra help or advice. He is definitely intolerant for idiots in class, so if your going to act stupid and be disrespectful then you might not want to take his class. :)

A good prof. If you go to class and do the work, he's more than willing to help out. A little tough at times, as well as picky, but I have enjoyed having him as a prof for the two classes I've had him in so far!

I had him for Writing for Public Communication. I thought he was knowledgeable and funny. He does not tolerate people acting stupid or not taking the class seriously, which made a lot of people in the class dislike him. Just don't act like a jerk and he will be a nice guy.
Really nice guy and helpful. I have had him for 2 classes now and got a B in both. Knows a lot in this field and will help you out with whatever you need.

I really enjoyed his class at the beginning of the semester. He is a great communicator, but became openly rude and arrogant after the first exam. Took weeks to post grades, seemed constantly irritable, and made the lecture room tense. I did enjoy the material, though.

his lecturing is understandable. A bit too patient with the idiots in the class when they need to get shut down, though. he's wicked smart, can answer any question, and will spend lots of time meeting with you. A+.

his lecturing is understandable. A bit too patient with the idiots in the class when they need to get shut down, though. he's wicked smart, can answer any question, and will spend lots of time meeting with you. A+.
Like him. You don't have to go to class. Just compare the notes on Web CT to the text, make sure you read the chapters and keep up. Excited to teach.
Take his 1135 class, it's not so much boring newswriting (this is my 2nd time around, hehe) and you have a final project THAT IS ACTUALLY FUN instead of a test.

I had him for intro to mass comm. He posts powerpoint notes on WEBCT and follows them. Gives quizzes over the pwrpt but you can use your notes. 2 papers were long and kinda hard, but if you follow his directions you'll get an A. Midterm was kinda hard. If you follow his directions you'll be fine. I wouldn't mind taking him again.

He an be very rude at times, and it is as if he is so not undersanding.  I didnt like that, and he really doesnt care much about emergencies I have learned that.  I mean the material he gives is fine but dont have an emergency during thr semester your having him, even if it is unavoidable.

This guy is a joke. All he does is show up late, tell personal stories (that are not funny, despite his laughter) about his radio job in Chicago, and is NEVER prepared for class. All he does is read from the book and explain personal concepts with lots of wordy language and "deep" thought. I think he is new, he sure teaches like it.

Very knowledgeable.  Class is not easy but he knows his stuff and spends a lot of time going over the subject matter.  Lectures can be long and boring but since he's fairly new to teaching I think he is still finding his "style."  Personally, I liked him and wouldn't mind another class with him.
He is a really nice guy, and I think it is his first year teaching, so be easy on him. He will work with you though!

When I first saw him I actually thought he was a student.  Then he started teaching and I really grew to respect him.  He's very helpful but his tests are some what difficult.  Just make sure you go to class and it shouldn't been too hard.  I like him...he's really corky and funny=:)Overall I would recommend him as a teacher.

I'm taking the class now. The quizes are a little tricky, but he thoroughly answers questions and he responds promptly to emails. He's very knowledgeable, and what he doesn't know, he will find out for you.
not hard if you take the practice tests, uses lots of examples in class.
